definition: inner area (of a place that has an outer area)/the kitchen of a restaurant (as opposed to the dining area)/infield (baseball etc)/(Chinese opera) the area behind the table on the stage
inside/inner/internal/within/interior
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: To hit(a ball) into the air just beyond the infield.
sentences.chinese: 棒球场分为内场和外场。

sentences.english: The field is divided into an infield and an outfield.
sentences.chinese: 棒球场分为内场和外场。

sentences.english: Infield is square and with red sand, each corner with a base.
sentences.chinese: 内场呈正方形，为红沙土场地，四角各设一个垒位。

sentences.english: You have to be very quick to get an infield homer.
sentences.chinese: 必须要跑得很快才能打一个内场本垒打。
他是个能攻善守的内场手。

sentences.english: Like them or not, guns are as American as covered wagons and the infield-fly rule.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢与否，枪一样覆盖车和内场飞统治美国。

sentences.english: The interception by an infielder of a throw to home plate from the outfield.
sentences.chinese: 内场手截球并从外场将球投回本垒板。

sentences.english: Mr Smith laid off a baseball diamond on the vacant lot.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生在空地上划出棒球内场的界线。

definition: outside world/society

outer area (of a place that has an inner area)/dining area of a restaurant (as opposed to the kitchen)/outfield (baseball etc)/area outside a venue (e.g. exterior of a stadium)/field (maintenance, testing etc)/(Chinese opera) the area in front of the table on the stage
vocal recital or concert
terrace/spectator's grandstand/viewing platform
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
glow stick/light stick
ticket (for theater, cinema etc)
sporting venue/arena
abbr. for 北京工人體育場|北京工人体育场[Bei3 jing1 Gong1 ren2 Ti3 yu4 chang3], Workers Stadium
to reserve all the seats (or a large block of seats) at a theater, restaurant etc
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
(of a singer) autograph session/record signing event
(of an actor, athlete etc) to prepare to make one's entrance/to wait in the wings
everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
admission by ticket only
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
multitude/vast crowd
